title: Easy Keyword Research for Amazon KDP (Keywords and Amazon ads for authors: PART 3)

tactics.name: Keyword Research with Publisher Rocket
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket to analyze search volume, competition, and pricing trends for Amazon KDP books
steps: Click magnifying glasses to view search results
Compare metrics like average price and monthly earnings
caveats: May not account for seasonal trends
source_quotes: Publisher Rocket will help you get your book in front of more amazon shoppers

tactics.name: long_tail_keywords
tactics.description: Prioritize longer keyword phrases over single-word keywords to reduce competition and target specific audiences
caveats: High competition may require significant ad spend
source_quotes: using a keyword phrase... generally is going to be good for you starting off

tactics.name: category_sales_analysis
tactics.description: Analyze category sales data to determine daily sales needed for bestseller rank
steps: Use competition analyzer to filter categories by sales
Sort categories by sales to top positions (e.g., #1, #10)
Export data to spreadsheet for tracking
caveats: Requires time to filter and sort data
source_quotes: if i write a book about the tango then i only have to sell one book per day
you need to have this information in front of you this is going to tell you how many sales you need to make every single day

tactics.name: Category BSR Analysis
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket to analyze category Best Seller Rank (BSR) and identify low BSR niches with high demand
steps: Check BSR thresholds (under 50,000 for high demand)
Prioritize categories with low BSR but high sales potential
source_quotes: low base low bsrs is good

heuristics.name: Low Review Threshold Boost
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize keywords
source_quotes: Three thousand dollars seven hundred twenty seven dollars three hundred twenty one dollars these aren't super high numbers

heuristics.name: competitive_score_adjustment
heuristics.condition: If competitive_score exceeds 50, add specific qualifiers to narrow search intent
source_quotes: weight loss is super competitive... add additional qualifiers

heuristics.name: low_competition_niche
heuristics.condition: If category requires fewer than 10 daily sales to reach #10 rank, prioritize
source_quotes: you only need to have one sale per day with this sort of book in order to reach number 10

heuristics.name: Review Count Threshold
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize categories with low review counts
source_quotes: low base low bsrs is good

claims.statement: Average price in a category can be skewed by top-performing books
source_quotes: The average price could be affected by some really well selling books

claims.statement: The keyword 'weight loss' has a competitive score of 100 (maximum)
source_quotes: weight loss... that's the most competitive it can possibly be

claims.statement: Bestseller rank thresholds vary by category, with some niches requiring as few as 1 daily sale
source_quotes: if i write a book about the tango then i only have to sell one book per day

claims.statement: Amazon allows books to be added to up to 10 categories via email request
source_quotes: you can actually create a message and send it to amazon

niche_patterns.description: Combines specific audience identity with problem and constraint for targeted keywords
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Captures niche demand while maintaining searchability
source_quotes: Motherhood facing and finding yourself is in fact the title of a book
